nl.inl.blacklab.search

Class QueryExecutionContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.QueryExecutionContext

  • public class QueryExecutionContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the current "execution context" for executing a TextPattern query. Inside a query, this context may change: a different property may be "selected" to search in, the case sensitivity setting may change, etc. This object is passed to the translation methods and keeps track of this context.

      • caseSensitive

        public boolean caseSensitive
        Search case-sensitive? NOTE: depending on available alternatives in the index, this will choose the most appropriate one.

      • diacriticsSensitive

        public boolean diacriticsSensitive
        Search diacritics-sensitive? NOTE: depending on available alternatives in the index, this will choose the most appropriate one.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueryExecutionContext

                     java.lang.String fieldName,
                     java.lang.String propName,
                     boolean caseSensitive,
                     boolean diacriticsSensitive)
        Construct a query execution context object.
        Parameters:
        searcher - the searcher object
        fieldName - the (complex) field to search
        propName - the property to search
        caseSensitive - whether search defaults to case-sensitive
        diacriticsSensitive - whether search defaults to diacritics-sensitive

      • luceneField

        public java.lang.String luceneField()
        Returns the correct current Lucene field name to use, based on the complex field name, property name and list of alternatives.
        Returns:
        null if field, property or alternative not found; valid Lucene field name otherwise

      • luceneField

        public java.lang.String luceneField(boolean includeAlternative)
        Returns the correct current Lucene field name to use, based on the complex field name, property name and list of alternatives.
        Parameters:
        includeAlternative - if true, also includes the default alternative at the end of the field name (alternatives determine stuff like case-/diacritics-sensitivity).
        Returns:
        null if field, property or alternative not found; valid Lucene field name otherwise
